name: Kepler-398
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-398 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-398 is a star with 0.5099999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.61 times its radius. It is located 581.44 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-398 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-398 b

Kepler-398 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.08 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-398.

The mass of Kepler-398 b is 0.81 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-398 b is 0.93 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-398 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-398 c

Kepler-398 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.42 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-398.

The mass of Kepler-398 c is 0.98 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-398 c is 1.01 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-398 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-398, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
